metadata.title: CVE-2020-27752 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/quantum-private.h. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger a heap buffer overflow. This would most likely lead to an impact to application availability, but could potentially lead to an impact to data integrity as well. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 7.0.9-0.

notes.note: mdeslaur> need to clarify exact patch, see Debian comment on upstream bug

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
